page.title: 19MEDIA IN ABERDEEN 2
page.content: Many of their reports involve outside broadcasts and they were one of the first networks to use an Electronic Newsgathering System,E.N.G. Northsound began in 1981.Most of its programmes consist of playing pop and light music.Their other function is to broadcast local news and information about local events which would not otherwise be broadcast on the national media. This year Cable T.V. was introduced in Aberdeen, the first cable station to open in Scotland.At present only a few areas of the city receive it but distribution is expected to increase over the next few years.As yet it is difficult to comment on its impact or future success. The public have direct access to Cable T.V. via a 'Speak Easy' booth located in the Rutherford Celebration Centre in Rosemount.
